intro: Eriosema himalaicum, commonly known as the Himalayan eriosema, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, often appearing in late summer. Eriosema himalaicum is typically found in moist, shaded habitats at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies in alpine environments.
